intro: Aplotaxis nivea, commonly known as the white aplotaxis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Aplotaxis nivea is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
